status.name: Closed

fields.description: After working on EUCA-9551, the IP tables SNAT rules were changed so we don't SNAT if the destination IP address is inside the private subnet. This change lead to the instances to not be able to ping, ssh, etc. using their own public IP. This means, I can SSH into my instance using the public IP but once inside the instance I cannot ping not SSH back in using that IP. Reverting the SNAT rule so it does not care about destination resolved this issue.
fields.summary: Instances cannot reach their assigned public IPs

comments.body:
I have been able to verify that, if the DNAT rules are change to ignore if the source IP is the instance source IP in both the POSTROUTING and OUTPUT chains, this issue goes away...

{noformat}
[root@c-04 net]# iptables -nvL -t nat
Chain PREROUTING (policy ACCEPT 31 packets, 1798 bytes)
 pkts bytes target     prot opt in     out     source               destination         
  930 55800 DNAT       tcp  --  *      *       0.0.0.0/0            169.254.169.254     tcp dpt:80 to:10.111.1.15:8773 
    0     0 DNAT       all  --  *      *      !1.115.99.237         10.111.101.44       to:1.115.99.237 

Chain POSTROUTING (policy ACCEPT 0 packets, 0 bytes)
 pkts bytes target     prot opt in     out     source               destination         
   61  4026 SNAT       all  --  *      *       1.115.99.237        !1.115.64.0/18       to:10.111.101.44 
    0     0 MASQUERADE  all  --  *      *       1.115.64.0/18       !1.115.64.0/18       

Chain OUTPUT (policy ACCEPT 0 packets, 0 bytes)
 pkts bytes target     prot opt in     out     source               destination         
    0     0 DNAT       all  --  *      *      !1.115.99.237         10.111.101.44       to:1.115.99.237 
[root@c-04 net]# 
{noformat}

[~nurmi], I think this fix is our best bet. Do you have any objections or better recommendation?
[~viglesias] told me to mark this to be resolved in 4.0.1

I ran 4.0.1 packages with this commit on a system which were failing/showing this error without the patch. I verified that the rules were being cleaned up below is the topo I tested with ( multi-cluster, multi-hyper, multi-node, etc). 


10.111.1.1	CENTOS	6.5	64	REPO	[CLC WS OSG UI]
10.111.1.40	CENTOS	6.5	64	REPO	[CC00 SC00]
10.111.1.41	CENTOS	6.5	64	REPO	[NC00]
10.111.5.59	CENTOS	6.5	64	REPO	[NC00]
10.111.5.60	CENTOS	6.5	64	REPO	[CC01 SC01]
10.111.5.69	VMWARE	ESXI-5.1	64	REPO	[NC01]

Verified the instances could ping their own public ips...


{code}
In [48]: wins.sys('ping ' + wins.ip_address)
[2014-07-14 10:59:03,349] [i-38517ce3] [DEBUG]: winrm timeout:None, cmd:ping 10.111.103.26
[2014-07-14 10:59:06,407] [i-38517ce3] [DEBUG]: Command:"ping 10.111.103.26" , Done.
[2014-07-14 10:59:06,460] [i-38517ce3] [DEBUG]: 

Pinging 10.111.103.26 with 32 bytes of data:
Reply from 10.111.103.26: bytes=32 time<1ms TTL=64
Reply from 10.111.103.26: bytes=32 time<1ms TTL=64
Reply from 10.111.103.26: bytes=32 time<1ms TTL=64
Reply from 10.111.103.26: bytes=32 time<1ms TTL=64

Ping statistics for 10.111.103.26:
    Packets: Sent = 4, Received = 4, Lost = 0 (0% loss),
Approximate round trip times in milli-seconds:
    Minimum = 0ms, Maximum = 0ms, Average = 0ms

{code}

I was having a similar problem.  I saw these errors in the cc.log file:
{code}
2014-07-13 22:45:47  INFO | terminating 1 instance(s): i-ee19ec5e
2014-07-13 22:45:47 ERROR | failed to remove DNAT rule '-D PREROUTING -d 10.111.55.240 -j DNAT --to-destination 172.16.56.123'
2014-07-13 22:45:48 ERROR | failed to remove DNAT rule '-D OUTPUT -d 10.111.55.240 -j DNAT --to-destination 172.16.56.123'
2014-07-13 22:45:58  INFO | terminating 1 instance(s): i-ee19ec5e
2014-07-13 22:46:13  INFO | instances: 0002 (0000 extant + 0000 pending + 0002 terminated)
{code}

I had to restart the eucalyptus processes in order to re-establish access.
Working with [~chuck] on a secondary issue which may not fwd back to the VM.

Verified the changes worked in my private banche:

{noformat}
[root@c-19 cluster]# iptables -nvL -t nat
Chain PREROUTING (policy ACCEPT 93703 packets, 72M bytes)
 pkts bytes target     prot opt in     out     source               destination         
    0     0 DNAT       all  --  *      *       0.0.0.0/0            10.111.101.183      to:1.117.102.154 
    0     0 DNAT       tcp  --  *      *       0.0.0.0/0            169.254.169.254     tcp dpt:80 to:10.111.1.15:8773 

Chain POSTROUTING (policy ACCEPT 8871 packets, 559K bytes)
 pkts bytes target     prot opt in     out     source               destination         
    0     0 SNAT       all  --  *      *       1.117.102.154        1.117.102.154       to:10.111.101.183 
    4   248 SNAT       all  --  *      *       1.117.102.154       !1.117.102.144/28    to:10.111.101.183 
    0     0 MASQUERADE  all  --  *      *       1.117.64.0/18       !1.117.64.0/18       

Chain OUTPUT (policy ACCEPT 8823 packets, 555K bytes)
 pkts bytes target     prot opt in     out     source               destination         
    0     0 DNAT       all  --  *      *       0.0.0.0/0            10.111.101.183      to:1.117.102.154 
{noformat}

Can ping from inside instance and can SSH to myself and not CC.

Verified fix using ping/ssh. vmware and kvm. 
Name        : eucalyptus
Arch        : x86_64
Version     : 4.0.1
Release     : 0.0.22245.37.20140725gitfa08d5e.el6
